poem:
Title: The Sailing Call 

Leaving Derby, suburban life behind.
They built a vessel, dream-designed.
All at sea, far from the grind,
A globe to navigate, a clock to unwind.
Maurice and Maralyn, in tandem, resigned,
Their bungalow, memories, boxed and lined.
Six years of study, every possible bind,
To adventure hankered, to no timetable confined.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Maurice and Maralyn by Sophie Elmhirst review – all at sea When Maurice and Maralyn Bailey decided to build a boat and sail to the other side of the world, it was not on a whim. The couple from Derby had long hankered for adventures that would lift them out of their dreary suburban existence. Over six years, they diligently studied boat designs, routes, timetables and supplies. They gave up their jobs, sold their bungalow". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
